name: 2014 Portland Guardian Store Championship 3rd Place
description: Went 4-0 at the tourney with 1 meat damage flatline, 1 net damage flatline, and two 7-0 agenda point victories. Published on request.

Not playtested yet, but im afraid MU might be a problem ?

Suggestions very welcome !

name: Jinteki Harmony Medtech
description:
Mushin No Shin to combo with Plan B and Toshiyuki Sakai. Plan B into agenda and Toshiyuki Sakai into Junebug or Cerebral Overwriter.

Precog and Accelerated Diagnostics for the occasional hilariousness.

name: Planszomania.pl 2014 Store Champion 2st Place Deck
description:
Standard Aggressive Gabriel.

Won 4 out of 5 games.

Use Fearie to run early. Run early/FAO HQ to know what ice is there to prepare for Siphons. Don't take out tags unless you assume that opponent uses Closed Accounts.

name: Planszomania.pl 2014 Store Champion 2st Place Deck
description:
Burned By News Win 3 out of 5 games.

This is a mix of rush with t'n'b. I always like to have options and switch strategies during play.

To rush: draw a lot. Score early astro from 1-2 ice remote. To tnb: draw a lot. There is no ICE tagging here, so the only way to tag is by suprise: Midseason, 1-3x TGTBT from archives, bernice mai, or Snare!.

Surprisingly a lot of players throw out Plascrete and run on 4th click vs TWIY* and this is the alternative way to win. Of course on tournament it is hard to not let opponents know that you have SE in the deck after few rounds.

name: RSVP regrets only. 2.0
description: I've been play testing this a lot lately and it seems to do well. I've moved from FA decks that use any 4/2 to no (in case, still one) 4/2. I prefer the 3/2 or 3/1 so I'm never stuck holding a character assassination (or efficiency committee) instead of scoring. The increased agenda density doesn't mean much, it still takes 4 agenda minimum and it may take more depending on what the runner pulls. Focus on scoring any 3/2 you draw and let the runner spend creds going for (hopefully) a 3/1. There will be games you will lose because the runner lucked into the 3/2s while you were stuck with the 3/1s. It hasn't been common though. Many games seem to go to 5 agendas scored to win and the economic drain of having to score the 5th agenda, as well as the taxing ICE, tilts the balance a little in your favor since your ability to score isn't made any more difficult. I would like to get two more 3/1 agendas over the character assassination, as well as 1-2 more interns to return Sansan, ASH, or Red herrings, but I don't want to drop any more ICE or economy.

name: Noise: Mill 'em ad nauseum v2
description:
This is an updated version of a deck I posted a while ago: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/1582/mill--em-ad-nauseum---a-nearly-naked-runner

The object of the deck is to always have options, and always be milling. Try to install at least one virus per turn. Run to make the corp rez. Trash ETR ice with Parasites and deal with the fallout from non-ETR. Hostage helps give you flexibility bringing out the connection you need. ProCon near the beginning, Aesop in the middle, John Masanori at the end as a means of getting a tag so you can DLR.

The deck has a more consistent source of credits with ProCon, and you can sell cheap programs with Aesop to get cash for a Liberated to get big bursts. The deck still has few breakers, but three Knights and some Stimhacks help you break through in key moments. If they trash the ice hosting your Knights, that's probably a good thing.

This isn't the winningest deck, but it's exciting to play and makes for an interesting and unpredictable game. It feels very anarch.

name: RSVP regrets only. 2.0
description: I forgot I had added tgtbt when I was messing around and hadn't changed the deck back to 3x Breaking news. Tgtbt is nice but if you have a sansan out you can drop, advance, score, and pop a resource. The look on the runners face when you trash their 12c Kati Jones is always beautiful. :)

description: -Needs help focusing down to 45, possible economy issues, just threw some stuff together before today's casual games, wanted to get this down and saved for modifying later.

description: Economy and tag punishment

name: Baby's first Shaper
description:
07/02/2014

Remarks :

Will later be improved with Plascrete Carapace rather than Crash Space when I get it (however Crash Space is still useful to remove tags, from Siphon for instance)

Lots of money to run a "classic" breakers suite, however here I want to try out cloak + dagger to see how it goes.

Also some R&D potential with Indexing + R&D interface, it's possible that having both is redundant.

Draw is done exclusively with Professionals Contacts, it can be interesting to change that to a event based draw, since the deck has a bunch of money already.

Finally, a netshield is around to help with the annoying Jinteki players I face sometimes, as Hosukai Grid + the base Identity gets aggravating.
